intro: Pinalia, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are typically herbaceous perennials with dark green, lance-shaped leaves. They produce clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Pinalia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
